Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 3.4 Å (narrowed after IL confinement), 4.0 Å (dilated at elevated temperature)

Other Information.Additional Info: CO2 permeability decreases with increasing IL concentration.
N2 molecules are cut off due to the narrowed effective cage size.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion between CO2 and N2 by tuning the effective cage size with confined IL.

Experimental Validation.Method: Gas permeation measurements using constant-volume method
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Best CO2 permeability: 117 Barrer, Best CO2/N2 selectivity: 84.5 (IL8@ZIF-8/Pebax MMMs with 25 wt% filler loading)

Other Information.Additional Info: The effective cage size is tuned by controlling the IL content inside ZIF-8 nanocages. The strategy surpasses the 2008 Robeson upper bound for CO2/N2 separation.
